intro: Senecio cucullatus, commonly known as the helmet flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. Senecio cucullatus is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, making it a notable addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
